title: Business Live: Sterling at $1.34 - BBC News
summary: easyjet to launch planes with electric engines .
strong six months for fashion retailer boohoo .
profits more than double at hotel chocolat .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's all from the business live page for tonight .
please join us again from 06:00 tomorrow .

documents.title: trump urges tax cuts
text: us president donald trump is calling for major tax cuts for business in a speech , as a longstanding republican effort to overhaul the us tax code takes centre stage .
t
op republicans released a framework for the overhaul that includes lowering the tax rate for corporations from 35 % to 20 % , among other changes .
but many aspects remain unknown .
republicans are looking for a policy win , after repeated failure to reform us healthcare .

documents.title: bombardier jobs 'important ' says may
text: prime minister theresa may has said that the thousands of jobs under threat in northern ireland after a us ruling against plane maker bombardier are `` important '' .

`` we 're very clear about the importance of bombardier , the importance of those jobs in northern ireland , and we will be doing everything we can to ensure that we can see those jobs being guaranteed into the future , '' she said .

documents.title: amazon says google has pulled youtube from echo show device
text: in a rare public feud between large technology companies , amazonhas said its echo show devices could no longer play videos from youtube because the site 's parent , google , stopped supporting the service .
the spat is the latest in silicon valley in which competitive tensions stand in the way of customers .
amazon and google square off in many areas , from cloud computing to selling voice-controlled gadgets like the echo show .

documents.title: moody 's upgrades lloyds long-term deposit rating
text: moody 's has upgraded lloyds bank long-term deposit and senior unsecured debt ratings from a1 to aa3 .
lloyds banking group 's chief executive , antonio horta-osorio , said :
the upgrade by moody 's reflects the work undertaken over the last six years to transform the bank into a simple , low-risk retail and commercial bank .
`` this transformation underpinned the bank 's recent return to full private ownership .

`` going forward , we remain totally focused on ensuring that the renewed strength of the bank is used to deliver sustainable returns for our shareholders and increasing support to our customers , as part of our commitment to help britain prosper . ''

documents.title: regulator launches enforcement action against ryanair
text: the civil aviation authority ( caa ) is probing ryanair for failing to give customers accurate information about their rights following a wave of flight cancellations .

the regulator has asked for a meeting with the airline as part of a consultation that will last at least seven days and could take legal action for breaching consumer protection laws `` if necessary '' , it said .

documents.title: amazon revamps echo smart speaker family
text: amazon has announced new versions of its echo smart speakers that promise improved sound and voice recognition .
the basic model also allows its shell to be changed to give it different looks - a feature already offered by google 's rival home device .
a larger echo plus adds a `` home hub '' , letting it control smart light bulbs and other third-party products without a separate data-linking device .
and the echo spot has a screen , making video calls and camera feeds possible .
read more here .
author: Leo Kelion
Technology desk editor

documents.title: republicans launch tax reform plan
text: donald trump 's republican party are lining up in congress to announce their support for a plan to reform america 's tax code , calling for deep cuts to corporate rates and the abolition of inheritance tax in a bid to salvage the president 's agenda .
`` this is our best opportunity in a generation to deliver real middle-class tax relief , create jobs here at home , and fuel unprecedented economic growth , '' house speaker paul ryan said .
`` it has been 31 years since we last got this done , and hardworking families and small businesses can not afford to wait any longer . ''

documents.title: google to treat shopping rivals equally , in line with eu order
text: google will treat its own shopping service the same as rivals when they bid for ads at the top of a search page , the company said on wednesday , as it seeks to comply with an eu antitrust order and stave off fresh fines .
`` we 're giving comparison shopping services the same opportunity to show shopping ads from merchants on google 's search results pages as we give to google shopping , '' spokesman al verney said .
`` google shopping will compete on equal terms and will operate as if it were a separate business , participating in the auction in the same way as everyone else , '' he said .
the changes will go into effect on thursday and apply only in europe .

documents.title: waitrose recalls luxury chocolate bars
text: waitrose has recalled four types of luxury chocolate bars over fears they may contain pieces of plastic .
the food standards agency ( fsa ) said the 85g waitrose 1 bars , which have a best before date of july 2018 , `` could represent a safety risk '' and urged customers not to eat them .

the affected bars include white chocolate , white chocolate with matcha tea and pistachio , milk chocolate with pistachio , almond and hazelnut and milk chocolate with feuilletine and sea salt , the fsa said .
in a statement , waitrose said : `` we are recalling the above products , as there is the potential that a small number of bars may be contaminated with pieces of plastic .
`` customers who have purchased any of the above products should not consume them , but return them to waitrose for a full refund .
`` we apologise for any inconvenience to our customers . ''
customers who bought the affected chocolate bars can call waitrose on 0800 188884 .

documents.title: sofia vergara is highest paid tv actress
text: the modern family star tops the forbes list for the highest paid tv actresses for the sixth time in a row .

documents.title: trump 'will not negotiate on 20 % corporate tax rate '
text: us president donald trump said wealthy americans would not benefit under his tax plan and that he would not negotiate on the republicans ' tax framework proposal to lower the corporate tax rate to 20 % .
`` no i do n't benefit .
i think there 's very little benefit for people of wealth , '' trump told reporters at the white house .
on the corporate tax rate , he said : `` i wanted to start at 15 [ % ] so that we got 20 [ % ] - 15 was so low we did n't take in the revenue .
but i wanted 15 so we got 20 , 20 's my number so i 'm not negotiating that number .
i am not going to negotiate . ''

documents.title: trump proposes tax cuts for the wealthy
text: billionaire us president donald trump has proposed to slash taxes for the wealthy and for businesses .
the plan faces an uphill battle in congress with his own party divided and democrats hostile .
the plan gave scant details about how to pay for the cuts without dramatically driving up federal deficits .

the proposal would lower corporate income tax rates , cut taxes for `` pass-through '' businesses , reduce the top income tax rate for individual americans and scrap some widely used tax breaks , including one that benefits people in high-tax states dominated by democrats .
big business embraced the plan , while democrats voiced opposition .
republicans have produced no major legislative successes since trump took office in january even though they control the white house and both chambers of congress .

documents.title: ryanair shenanigans
text: ryanair is cancelling flights in order to avoid cancelling flights .

the company has decided that it is better to alter its winter schedule now , and fly fewer planes than originally planned , in order to avoid potentially more serious disruption over the next few months .
short notice cancellations are more expensive , because passengers have a right to compensation , they can leave people stranded and generally tend to tarnish an airline 's image .
the move also has the benefit of keeping more of ryanair 's pilots on side .
the company had threatened to postpone some of their leave to deal with the crisis for example ; it will no longer have to do that .

it could also be argued that by taking action now , ryanair has removed some of the pilots ' bagaining power at a time when there were signs some at least were agitating for new , and better contracts .
author: Theo Leggett
BBC Business News Reporter

documents.title: special relationship 'will not insulate uk in us trade deals '
text: following the us ruling on boeing and bombardier that could threaten more than 4,000 jobs in northern ireland , people should n't be surprised that trade decisions are intensely political , says business professor steve mcguire of the university of sussex .
while us president donald trump has made a bete noire of china , blaming it for a multitude of us economic woes , boeing 's largest foreign market is china .
so in boeing 's case , the us `` a fight with a canadian rival helps build political capital '' for mr trump 's administration while keeping access to the chinese market , professor mcguire says .
he adds this does not bode well for future uk and us trade negotiations .
`` in the bombardier case , the us has a fight with canada , one of its closest allies and major trade partners .

`` this , along with the nationalist tone of so much of trump 's pronouncements on trade , should disabuse the uk from any belief that the special relationship will insulate it from us action in the post-brexit world . ''

documents.title: us ruling 'cuts investor confidence in bombardier supply chain '
text: the first # bombardier supplier to speak since # boeing row tells me on @ twitterid the us ruling cuts investment confidence for supply-chain
# brexit

documents.title: south african parliament ends kpmg contract
text: the south african parliament has ended its contract with auditor kpmg , reuters reports .
in mid-september the accountancy firm removed the bosses of its south african arm after an internal investigation into work it did for the wealthy gupta family .
kpmg become embroiled in controversy from dealing with the gupta family 's group of businesses , after fallout from the bell pottinger scandal .
bell pottinger collapsed into administration earlier this month after running a racially charged pr campaign in south africa .
the pr firm worked on the controversial campaign for oakbay , a company owned by the guptas .
the work was criticised for presenting opponents of president jacob zuma and the guptas as agents of `` white monopoly capital '' .

documents.title: ryanair drops alitalia bid
text: as well as cancelling an extra 18,000 flights over the winter months , ryanair has also dropped its bid to buy the italian airline , alitalia .
`` in order to focus on repairing this rostering problem this winter , ryanair will eliminate all management distractions starting with its interest in alitalia , '' it said .
`` we have notified the alitalia bankruptcy commissioners that we will not be pursuing our interest in alitalia or submitting any further offers for the airline . ''

documents.title: fallon rules out cancelling boeing orders
text: uk defence secretary michael fallon has ruled out cancelling uk orders with boeing for nine spy planes and 60 helicopters over the boeing dispute , reuters reports .
mr fallon had earlier said that boeing 's dispute with canadian rival bombardier , which has put 4,200 jobs at risk in northern ireland , could `` jeopardise our future relationship with them . ''
`` boeing has significant defence contracts with us and still expects to win further contracts .
boeing wants and we want a long-term partnership but that has to be two-way , '' he said .
however , in february , boeing said it planned to open a £ 20m factory in sheffield .
that is a factor that could put boeing in quite a strong bargaining position with the uk government .

documents.title: reality check : decoding corbyn 's brexit policy
text: what did corbyn 's speech tell us about labour 's stance on brexit ?

documents.title: corbyn criticises 'rag-tag cabinet ' over brexit
text: jeremy corbyn has used his labour party conference speech to take a pop at the conservative government over brexit , saying the cabinet has failed so far to negotiate with the eu as one .
`` this rag-tag cabinet spends more time negotiating with each other than they do with the eu .
a cliff-edge brexit is at risk of becoming a reality , '' he said .
`` that is why labour has made clear that britain should stay within the basic terms of the single market and a customs union for a limited transition period . ''
labour has also not been unified on the issue of brexit , however .
london mayor sadiq khan said in a newspaper interview on tuesday that he would back holding a second brexit referendum , a position the party itself has not suggested so far .
mr corbyn told members that if in power , labour would pursue a `` jobs first '' brexit , one that guaranteed unimpeded access to the single market .
`` so i have a simple message to the cabinet - for britain 's sake pull yourself together , or make way , '' he said .

documents.title: bank of america 'looks for more paris office space '
text: bank of america wants to lease more office space in paris as the bank prepares for brexit , reuters reports .

international banks are building up outposts in the eu so they can continue to serve clients if london operations lose the ability to operate across the bloc once britain leaves the eu in march 2019 .

documents.title: wall street higher as trump 's tax plan awaited
text: us stocks are higher as investors wait for president donald trump to outline his new tax plan later in the day .
mr trump will call for slashing tax rates on businesses and the wealthy as part of the new plan , which , if passed , would be his first significant legislative win since taking office in january .
the dow jones industrial average was up 59.52 points , or 0.27 % , to 22,343.84 .
the s & p 500 gained 8.42 points , or 0.34 % , to 2,505.40 .
the nasdaq composite added 48.42 points , or 0.75 % , to 6,427.69 .

documents.title: brexiters 'naive over us trade '
text: the eu and us have been arguing over airbus for decades , but the reason the us has never resorted to `` heavy-handed tactics '' against the eu is it has far too much to lose , centre for european reform chief economist simon tilford writes in the guardian .

however , the bombardier ruling , which threatens more than 4,000 uk jobs , `` gives us a real taste of how the uk will be treated in negotiations over a us-uk trade deal post-brexit , and how vulnerable the country will be , '' mr tilford says .

`` the uk government , particularly its trade minister liam fox , places great faith in a trade agreement with the us , arguing that britain will get a good deal because of the dense commercial links between the two countries .
but trade deals are all about leverage , and leverage is determined by the size of the market , '' he adds .

documents.title: government 'very disappointed ' over bombardier decision
text: the government is `` very disappointed '' about a us court decision in favour of boeing that could threaten 4,000 bombardier jobs in northern ireland , minister james brokenshire says .
`` we are clearly very disappointed with this initial determination .
`` boeing 's position in this case is unjustified and not what would be expected of a long-term partner to the uk .

`` as the prime minister has made clear , we will continue to defend uk interests and work with bombardier to protect vital jobs and livelihoods among the 4,200 skilled workers and their families in belfast and across northern ireland .
`` we will also continue to work closely with the canadian government to encourage all parties to reach a credible resolution as quickly as possible . ''

documents.title: government 'needs to get a backbone ' over bombardier
text: the uk government has been complacent in not pushing boeing and the us government hard enough over bombardier , according to labour 's shadow northern ireland minister owen smith .
a us ruling in favour of boeing could threaten thousands of bombardier jobs in belfast .

mr smith said : `` this damaging ruling was widely predicted and yet our government appears to have done very little of substance to persuade either boeing to withdraw its claim or the us administration to rule against it .

`` i wrote to the prime minister a fortnight ago , urging her to speak out in support of 4,000 bombardier workers in belfast just as vigorously as her canadian counterpart has done , but she has failed to act .

justin trudeau said clearly that he would cancel contracts with boeing if they persisted with their unreasonable action , yet mrs may has refused to use our commercial and economic clout in the same way .
such complacency is totally unacceptable , and bombardier workers and british industry more broadly , needs the government to get a backbone and stand up for our interests . ''

documents.title: schaeuble to 'step down as german finance minister '
text: german finance minister wolfgang schaeuble will become president of the german parliament , a position that would require him to quit as minister , reuters reports .

the bild newspaper also reports that mr schaeuble , the longest-serving member of parliament , had been urged by chancellor angela merkel to take the post of president of the bundestag parliament , and that mr schaeuble had agreed to do so .

documents.title: ryanair to cancel an extra 18,000 flights
text: more woes for ryanair passengers .
the budget carrier is to cancel an extra 18,000 flights in a move that will hit 400,000 customers .
the firm has been forced into the cancellations after miscalculating pilot leave .
as a result , 34 routes are suspended for the winter season from november to march 2018 .
they include several popular routes used by uk travellers , including london stansted to edinburgh and glasgow , gatwick to belfast , newcastle to faro , and glasgow to las palmas .
boss michael o'leary said : `` we sincerely apologise to those customers who have been affected by last week 's flight cancellations , or these sensible schedule changes announced today . ''
read more here .

documents.title: amazon and google clash over youtube access
text: amazon and google have clashed publicly after access to youtube was pulled from one of the online retailer 's devices .
on tuesday , youtube stopped working on amazon 's echo show , a voice-controlled assistant with a screen that can display information and videos .
both companies issued statements criticising one another .
amazon said google had blocked youtube on echo show `` without explanation '' .
google said the echo show delivered a `` broken user experience '' .

documents.title: corbyn justifies plan to take back water companies
text: more from the labour leader .
`` now is the time for the government to take a more active role in restructuring our economy .
`` now is the time that corporate boardrooms are held accountable for their actions .
now is the time that we developed a new model of economic development to replace the failed dogmas of neo-liberalism .
mr corbyn points out that of the nine water companies in the uk , six are owned by private equity investors or overseas sovereign wealth funds .
`` their profits are handed out in dividends to shareholders while their infrastructure crumbles . ''
`` executive pay has soared while as the service deteriorates . ''
he says that justifies labour 's plan to re-nationalise the water industry .

documents.title: hundreds of thousands of passengers hit by ryanair movethe guardian tweets
text: ryanair to cancel flights affecting 400,000 more passengers

i thought ba 's executives were incompetent , but ryanair are a close 2nd !
ooooops

documents.title: corbyn : uk could become 'tax haven '
text: labour leader jeremy corbyn claims the uk has a dismal future under one brexit scenario :
`` a powerful faction in conservative leadership sees brexit as their chance to create a tax haven on the shores of europe .
`` a low-wage , low-tax de-regulated playground for hedge funds and speculators .

`` a few at the top would do very , very nicely out of this but manufacturing industries would go to the wall taking skilled jobs with them , our tax base would crumble and our public services would be slashed still further . ''

documents.title: ryanair grounds cancellations ?
text: irish independent business reporter john mulligan tweets :
@ twitterid will `` end rostering cancellations '' by slowing growth this winter ; grounding 25 jets from november and 10 from april 18 .
# aviation

documents.title: fine art
text: former bp boss lord browne has a new job at the courtauld - which is part of the university of london , by the way .
great pleasure to be welcomed as new chairman of the courtauld yesterday and to introduce 300 new students to the institute
and to tell them you 're the man responsible for the debt mountains they will build

documents.title: profit rise for house builder cruden
text: scottish house builder cruden has seen its pre-tax profits jump by a third in a year to more than £ 10m .
the company also doubled the number of homes it sold and saw growth in the value of its public sector contracts .
revenue grew to £ 200m in the year to march , from £ 154m .
pre-tax profits rose from £ 7.5m to £ 10.4m .
the number of homes sold by the company rose from 139 to 280 .
however , the average price fell to £ 226,000 , with prices ranging from £ 99,000 to £ 1.3m .
among the firm 's most prestigious developments was the grange , in south edinburgh , featuring 24 luxury three-storey townhouses and 57 executive apartments .
the company 's construction division has been appointed as preferred bidder to build more than 700 homes over the next three years

documents.title: us dollar continues to roll higher
text: as the chart above shows , the euro has continued its slide against the dollar , now heading towards $ 1.17 .
analysts are saying that the prospect of tax cuts in the us are helping boost the us currency .
the trump administration along with republicans in congress are due to outline their tax plans later .

`` we 're now seeing some embryonic prospects of a tax reform in the united states which is a much bigger issue for the markets than the federal reserve , '' said ray attrill , global head of foreign exchange strategy at national australia bank .
`` our view has been the market had moved from applying a trump premium from november-december to applying trump discount due to his inability to pass any major reforms .
a meaningful tax reform could serve to reduce some of that discount . ''

documents.title: pick a number , any number
text: guardian technology reporter alex hern is getting worked up about twitter 's xl tweet plan :
this is a small change , but a big move for us .
140 was an arbitrary choice based on the 160 character sms limit .
proud of how thoughtful the team has been in solving a real problem people have when trying to tweet .
and at the same time maintaining our brevity , speed , and essence !

documents.title: potential shock awaits pension saversbbc personal finance reporter kevin peachey tweets
text: one suggestion from @ twitterid is that weaker schemes join `` superfunds '' - cd have implications for pension savers

documents.title: crackdown on betting 's 'crack cocaine '
text: the boss of betting firm paddy power betfair has broken ranks with the rest of the industry to endorse calls for stricter limits on fixed odd betting machines , according to the financial times .

the ft has seen a letter from breon corcoran to the department of culture , media and sport saying the infamous betting terminals ( dubbed by critics the `` crack cocaine '' of gambling ) are `` so toxic '' that nothing but decisive action would address societal concerns '' .
he 's suggesting the government should implement a machine stakes limit of £ 10 or less '' - campaigners have called for a maximum bid of £ 2 .
betting companies have previously argued against a reduction , claiming it would lead to shop closures , job losses and a hit to tax receipts .

documents.title: perk life
text: what would tempt you to switch job ?
free holidays ?
unlimited paid leave ?
or perhaps a financial contribution to freezing eggs , to help with future fertility ?
anyhow there 's more in eleanor lawrie 's piece .

documents.title: have jaffa cakes become more expensive ?
text: in response to the news yesterday that mcvitie 's was reducing the number of jaffa cakes in a pack from 12 to 10 , the company said the price per cake had not changed , but that pricing is down to retailers .
while shops do indeed decide what price to charge , mcvitie 's has a recommended retail price ( rrp ) .
a single pack has gone from 12 to 10 cakes , with the rrp cut from £ 1.15 to 99p .
so that 's a change in price per cake from 9.6p to 9.9p - a rise of 3.3 % .
the twin packs have gone from 24 to 20 cakes , with the rrp going from £ 2.19 to £ 1.89 .
that 's a 3.6 % increase in price per cake .
the latest figures from the ons show inflation measured by the cpi in august was 2.9 % .
so the recommended price per cake has gone up by more than inflation for both pack sizes .
author: Reality Check

documents.title: dup wades into bombardier row
text: the leader of northern ireland 's democratic unionist party , on whose support theresa may relies to stay in government , says it will use its influence over the tories in the bombardier dispute .
`` everyone realises how important bombardier is to northern ireland and we will use our influence with our government to make sure that continues , '' says foster ( right with may ) .
`` what we must do now is to continue to work with our own government , with the american government , with the canadian government , in trying to get boeing to see sense , '' she adds .

documents.title: day of protest in south africa
text: south africa 's largest trade union federation , cosatu has called for a general strike today to protest against corruption and job losses .
in a statement cosatu said : `` corruption has become endemic under this administration .
`` this calls for all of us as workers and citizens to stand up and push back against this rot . ''
while the protest is officially over corruption , many protesters are directing their frustration at president jacob zuma , calling for him to stand down .
the above is from johannesburg today .

documents.title: breakingscania hit with 880m euros fine
text: eu competition regulators have fined scania 880m euros for taking part in a truckmakers cartel that resulted in a record 2.9bn euro fine for four companies in july .

the european commission said the volkswagen-owned truck maker colluded for 14 years with the other cartel members on truck pricing and on passing on the costs of new technologies to meet stricter emission rules .
man , which is also owned by volkswagen , daimler , volvo , iveco and daf admitted to taking part in the cartel in return for a 10 % cut in their fines .
scania did not settle .

documents.title: qatar urged to protect migrant workers
text: human rights watch ( hrw ) is urging qatari authorities to do more to protect migrant construction workers from the nation 's intense heat and humidity .
at the moment outdoor work is prohibited between 11:30 and 15:00 from 15 june to 31 august .
but hrw says that conditions outside of these dates and times can be potentially fatal .
there are approximately 800,000 migrant workers employed in construction in qatar , many helping to build infrastructure for the 2022 fifa world cup .
in 2013 there were 520 migrant worker deaths , the report says .

documents.title: has the uk been promoted to number four ?
text: here 's a new one from former work and pensions secretary iain duncan smith , who wrote on the conservative home website that the uk is the world 's fourth largest economy .
we heard a number of claims last year that the uk had fallen from being the world 's fifth largest economy to being the sixth as a result of post-referendum currency movements .
we debunked that claim in this reality check .
the latest figures from the world bank confirmed that the uk remained in the number five spot last year .
so we 're not sure on what basis mr duncan smith thinks the uk has been promoted to number four - maybe he is just talking up the economy .
author: Reality Check

documents.title: ryanair hands out £ 40 travel vouchers
text: simon calder is the independent 's travel editor
ryanair giving cancelled passengers £ 40/€40 travel voucher per flight on top of compensation .
terms/conditions apply

where 's that flying pig gone ?

documents.title: british still 'shopping cautiously ' says pz cussons
text: pz cussons , perhaps best known in the uk for its imperial leather soap , expects tough trading conditions to continue this year .
in a trading update it said : `` it is increasingly clear that consumers are shopping cautiously reflecting general cost inflation outstripping wage growth , and broader economic uncertainty . ''
however , firm says it remains `` on-track '' to deliver growth in operating profits .
and just a bit of history for you pz cussons has its roots in sierra leone , when george paterson and george zochonis set up a trading post there in 1884 .
pz bought cussons in 1975 , adding the imperial leather brand to its soap and detergents business .

documents.title: carillion shares soar on takeover talk
text: shares in builder carillion are up by close to 18 % after newspaper reports of a potential takeover bid by a middle east construction firm .
carillion has lost 75 % of its market value since mid-july when it booked an £ 845m writedown on problematic construction contracts and announced the departure of its chief executive

documents.title: french property scheme 'a slow-burning catastrophe '
text: a french property scheme is a `` slow-burning catastrophe '' for british investors who are trapped in costly contracts , an mep has said .
the leaseback schemes were aimed at encouraging people to buy properties in tourist areas , then rent them out .
it was supposed to offer the owners a guaranteed return , but many say they are trapped in costly contracts with management companies .
mep daniel dalton says the french government should help these people .
french leaseback schemes were first introduced in the 1980s as a way to increase investment in tourist destinations .
they were heavily marketed in the uk and ireland in the mid-2000s as a risk-free investment .
author: Victoria Derbyshire

documents.title: hong kong stocks rise in cautious asian session
text: markets in hong kong bucked the soft trend that spread across asia on wednesday .
wanda hotel development was a standout - with shares surging 10 % - after announcing a deal to buy assets from its parent company .
the broader hang seng index rose 0.4 % in late trading .
japan 's nikkei shed 0.3 % , or 63 points , to close at 20,267.05 .
markets in south korea and australia also retreated .
in seoul , the kospi edged down 0.1 % to close at 2,372.57 , while the s & p/asx 200 shed 0.1 % to 5,664.3 in sydney .

documents.title: shares fall 3 % at peppa pig maker
text: shares in canada-based , uk-listed media group entertainment one are down by more than 3 % .
it comes after the company released a largely upbeat trading update highlighting the rising global popularity of its famous children 's tv character peppa pig .
it said the film release of peppa pig : my first cinema experience raked had been a financial success in australia and new zealand .
it also said revenues had been better-than-expected in china , where peppa is gaining new fans , with demand also soaring for branded toys , clothing and home furnishings .
the cartoon has been broadcast on china 's cctv network and also viewed on chinese social media platforms since the launch of the brand in september 2015 .
however , on the downside the company did say that overall box office revenues at its film division had nearly halved so far in the year to date .

documents.title: boohoo.com shares slide
text: despite bumper half-year results , shares on boohoo.com have slumped more than 8 % this morning .
however those shares almost doubled in value this year , so some investors were likely to be looking for an excuse to take profits .

documents.title: grasping at straws
text: pub chain wetherspoons are calling time on plastic straws .
@ unep tells 5 live breakfast firms in uk should ''think deeply '' about their use
well done @ twitterid

they then go in the dishwasher

i 'm an adult and can drink without assistance , thanks .

documents.title: ftse 100 ahead at open of trading
text: the london benchmark index of leading shares was ahead in early morning trade on wednesday .
not long after open the blue-chip ftse was up by 36.27 points , or 0.49 % , at 7322 points .
financials and miners led the winners .
standard chartered , prudential and royal bank of scotland were ahead by 1.97 % , 1.57 % , and 1.57 % .
rio tinto and anglo american were up by about 1.5 % .
miners were also represented in the biggest fallers , who were mediclinic international , randgold , fresnillo , compass group and national grid .

documents.title: student loans company 'worst place to work '
text: the times reports that the student loans company is now the worst place to work in the public sector .
the report is based on a ratings from glassdoor.co.uk and indeed.co.uk .
less that a third of staff would recommend working for the company , compared with an average of 60 % across the whole public sector , the report says .

documents.title: wrecking ball
text: former mexican president vicente fox has had a pop at us president donald trump on , you guessed it , twitter overnight following the social media site 's decision to trial doubling the length of tweets .
just do n't mention the wall .
@ realdonaldtrump has been wrecking america 140 characters at a time .
imagine what he could do with 280 now .
it 's too late .
`` he 's destroying this country , each and every day ``

i guess it 's crazy but i still ca n't believe anyone could vote for that terrible man .

demand his arrest .

that 's chaos not order .
if we had hillary we would all be in knee deep shit .

youre the one who is ruining america .
jumping at every little thing he does like a moth to flame .
stop .

not useless politians who talk but do nothing .

he tanks on 140 .
the world will have to continue to call out @ twitterid for being # tweeterinchief and creating a # trainwreck in his homeland .
# notmypresident

documents.title: may 'bitterly disappointed ' at bombardier decision
text: uk prime minister theresa may says she is `` bitterly disappointed '' by the us department of commerce 's decision to impose a tariff of nearly 220 % on a new model of passenger jet manufactured by bombardier , one of northern ireland 's biggest employers .

documents.title: twitter trials 280-character tweet limit
text: social media site twitter is trialling longer character limits to help users `` easily express themselves '' .
twitter currently limits tweets to 140 characters , but has doubled that to 280 characters for a small group of users .
the current character limit was `` a major cause of frustration '' for some users , the firm said in a blog post .
the firm has been suffering from slowing growth and the shift could be one way for the firm to widen its appeal and attract new users .

documents.title: 'bombardier makes huge contribution to ni economy '
text: the cbi has responded to the us department of commerce 's preliminary ruling which proposes placing an interim tariff of nearly 220 % on the import of bombardier 's c-series jets to the us .
angela mcgowan , cbi northern ireland director , said : bombardier makes a huge contribution to the northern irish economy .
they are a major regional employer and support a wider supply chain that stretches across northern ireland .
the decision by the us department of commerce represents a challenge to the northern ireland economy and places an important driver of regional economic growth at risk .
this just reinforces the need for the swift return of an inclusive devolved government .
government and business must work in partnership to deliver a new far-reaching industrial strategy to improve regional resilience , economic competitiveness and facilitate growth .

with jobs and future prosperity in the region being put at risk by decisions made far away from belfast , we need a devolved government that can speak up for and champion the needs of the local workers and businesses most affected . ''

documents.title: c-series crucial to bombardier in northern ireland
text: the canadian aerospace company bombardier employs 4,500 people in northern ireland .
those jobs are being threatened by a decision taken in the us which means the firm would have to pay enormous tariffs on the c-series aircraft bombardier plans to sell to delta .
davy thompson is the regional co-ordinator for unite the union in northern ireland .
he says that in three years time the c-series jet is expected to account for 60 % of the work at the bombardier plant in northern ireland .
he thinks the government could do more to `` get the message out '' about how good the plane is , to encourage other airlines to take a look .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: airasia to fit broadband to 120 planes
text: airline airasia has signed a deal with satellite firm inmarsat to provide broadband access on 120 of its a320 and a330 airbus aircraft operated across the group , including at long-haul operator airasia x .
the first installations will commence in the first half of 2018 .
airasia boss tony fernandes said it would enable passengers to stream movies or music , check social media , message friends and send and receive emails .

documents.title: sweet times for hotel chocolat
text: profits have more than doubled at hotel chocolat .
it made a pre-tax profit of £ 11.2m in its financial year , which ended on 2 july .
that 's up from £ 5.6m in the previous year .
sales rose 12 % to £ 105.2m .
it opened 12 new stores over the year , taking its total to 94 stores .
the company has also introduced ice cream to 40 locations .

commenting on the outlook for the current financial year , the company said : `` the market and wider economy may not be without challenges , but we still have significant addressable market headroom in the uk and benefit from having distribution and manufacturing directly under our control , which supports the resilience of our business . ''

documents.title: strong six months for boohoo fashion group
text: online fashion retailer boohoo group has seen its revenues grow by 106 % in the half year to september , compared with the previous year .
the group said annual revenue growth was now expected to be around 80 % , up from its previous guidance of around 60 % .
meanwhile , pre-tax profit was up 41 % , and operating profit was up 42 % .
the company said : `` we will continue to invest in the customer proposition , further develop our brands and maximise the considerable opportunities that a global marketplace affords us . ''

documents.title: uber appeal ruling to have 'huge knock-on effect '
text: more on that uber appeal against an employment tribunal ruling that is drivers should be classified as workers .
jason moyer-lee is the general secretary of the independent workers ' union of great britain ( iwgb ) , which is representing uber drivers at the appeal today .
`` uber says that the judge got the law wrong [ at the employment tribunal ] , '' he told bbc radio five live 's wake up to money .
he said uber 's position was that it was merely an agent representing drivers in their dealings with passengers .
uber has also said that its drivers like the freedom of being their own boss , but mr moyer-lee said this only told part of the story .
`` many of our drivers are happy with many aspects of the so-called gig economy .
but i would n't say it is representative to say that uber drivers would n't [ accept ] holidays and pensions . ''
he also said that the affected drivers were not employees , but should be categorised as 'workers ' - a status which entitles them to workplace benefits .
and he said that if uber 's appeal failed `` the knock-on effect could be huge '' , with implications for thousands of other people working in the gig economy .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: easyjet 's electric plane project 'not ridiculous '
text: easyjet has partnered wright electric to work on an electric plane .
the bbc 's dominic o'connell says that ten years ago he attended an easjyjet event that promised `` the aircraft of tomorrow that would cut aircraft emissions by 50 % '' .
the company promised that it would be flying by 2015 .
it did n't happen .
`` the difference now is this is the [ aerospace ] industry coming back with a real option , saying this is something we can potentially bring to market , '' says peter duffy from easyjet .
`` i do n't think it is ridiculous , '' he added .
to make electric planes work batteries will have to be at least one-and-half times better than they are at the moment , according to jeffery engler founder of wright electric .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: easyjet backs electric plane plans
text: easyjet is backing plans to develop commercial passenger aircraft powered by electric batteries instead of conventional aero engines .
the airline wants the proposed planes to fly passengers on its short-haul routes , possibly within 10-20 years .
the prototype is going to be developed by a new us firm called wright electric , which has already built a two-seat battery-powered plane .
the new , larger plane would have a range of 335 miles , the companies said .
easyjet said this meant it would be able to cover popular routes such as london to paris , brussels , amsterdam , cologne , glasgow and edinburgh .

documents.title: uber in workers ' rights ruling appeal
text: more major news involving uber today .
it is not related to its recently-announced ban in london , but is related to an employment tribunal ruling from last year .
uber is appealing against the decision that its drivers are entitled to benefits including holiday pay .
the case will be heard at the high court later today .
in october , drivers won the right to be classed as workers , rather than self-employed , meaning they are entitled to the minimum wage and paid rest breaks .
the court ruled the idea its 30,000 drivers could be linked by a common platform was `` faintly ridiculous '' .
but uber insists its drivers like the freedom of being their own boss .

documents.title: bombardier row could drag on for months
text: the international trade commission will make a final decision early next year over whether harm has been done to boeing by the deal done between bombardier and delta .
but that 's not the end of it
according to lawyer christophe bondy either side could appeal to the world trade organisation or lodge an appeal under the nafta trade agreement .
by the time those appeals are heard the contract `` could not longer be viable '' he points out .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: is boeing using tough tactics ?
text: more on the row over bombardier 's order to supply delta with aircraft .
christophe bondy is special counsel at the law firm cooley and a former trade adviser to canadian government .
`` what 's most extraordinary about this case is that boeing was not actually a competitor of bombardier , '' he tells the today programme .
`` delta gave testimony last year saying that it had n't even considered boeing for this particular order .

`` so what 's troubling for the canadian government and users of the system generally is that boeing seems to be using this complaint , not because it 's suffered any particular harm in this case , but because it 's trying to drive bombardier out of the market . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: 'this could turn nasty '
text: thomas moore , investment director of uk equities at aberdeen standard investments , says the us commerce department 's ruling in favour of boeing could have implications for more than 4,000 jobs at the bombardier factory in belfast , which provides the wings for the c-series jet .
`` this could turn nasty , '' he told bbc radio five live 's wake up to money programme .
`` we have been living through a period of globalisation , and this indicates we could be moving into what mark carney has called a period of de-globalisation .
`` slapping this tariff on bombardier has implications for jobs in northern ireland .
we have got to hope that this gets resolved , given those jobs are at stake . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: bombardier fury at us commercial ruling
text: a quick recap of the major story overnight .
aerospace firm bombardier has described a ruling against it by the us department of commerce over its row with boeing as `` absurd '' .
an interim tariff of nearly 220 % has been proposed on the import of bombardier 's c-series jet to the us .
the canadian company says boeing is seeking to use us trade laws `` to stifle competition '' .
the uk government and trade unions fear the ruling could put the jobs of thousands of staff in northern ireland at risk .
boeing had complained its smaller rival got unfair state subsidies from the uk and canada , helping it win a major order .

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to another day of business and economics news with us here at the business live page .
